result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Robert J Hardy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Acceptance into the First Offender Program for 12 months
Order for stay of entry of judgment
With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case called at 2:55 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Robert J Hardy in court with Attorney Robert Franklin Nagel. DA Susan V. Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Hardy waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information; Arraignment:-service of Information admitted, reading waived

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #2 & Count #3; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered on Count #3 ONLY. Court withholds entry of JOC on Count #2 and adopts the Deferred Prosecution Agreement of the Parties.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1
Sentencing Arguments by Counsel; Statements by Roxanne Hardy

On Count #3, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:
--serve 20 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges; to commence 8/1/14 by 7:00 pm 
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Random urinalyses, not less than 1x/mth for the first 6 months
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program
--No possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--To pay costs of $243
--To pay $200 DNA Surcharge
--To pay $75 drug testing fee
--To reimburse $180 buy money
--No Contact with any known drug offender except as deemed appropriate per Agent

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Court presents basis and grants expungement on successful completion of probation and deferred prosecution agreement
Recess: 3:25 pm Reconvene: 3:26 pm 
Upon request of Defense Counsel, Court grants request to transfer sentence to Waukesha County as long as electronic monitoring is not utilized.
Recess: 3:27 pm Reconvene: 3:27 pm 
Upon request of Defense Counsel, Court grants request to have conditional jail start on August 4, 2014 by 6:00 pm
Recess: 3:27 pm
Preliminary hearing on July 18, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Case called at 10:35 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Robert J Hardy in court with Attorney Robert F Nagel. ADA Monica J Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Nagel: Did not follow-up with DA Happ following last hearing, do believe can have matter settled in about two weeks, just need one more brief discussion with DA before proceeding - requests additional STC
Court informs parties that It will set matter for preliminary hearing to keep case moving
ADA Hall: No position
Court reminds Mr. Hardy that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect while the case is pending
Recess: 10:39 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule Preliminary Hearing & possible Plea/Sentencing 7/18/14 at 2:30 pm - Send notices
Status conference on July 1, 2014 at 10:30 am.

[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
 Defendant Robert J Hardy in court with Attorney Robert F Nagel. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Nagel: Did have PTC last week and met with client this week to discuss offer. We do have more questions regarding settlement. Not ready to proceed to plea at this time, request matter 
ADA Tebuer: No objection
Court reminds Mr. Hardy that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect while case is pending

NEXT:  Schedule STC (possible plea/sentencing) 7/1/14 at 10:30 am - Send notices
Status conference on May 23, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 14, 2014 at 10:00 am.
